pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:0.5: 42. The second training rule on not brought
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six put the whole hand in their mouths while eating. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.3: “‘I will not put the whole hand in my mouth while eating,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.4: One should not put the whole hand in one’s mouth while eating.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.5: If a monk out of disrespect puts the whole hand in his mouth while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.7: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.9: The second training rule is finished.
